Title: The Crystal Ring.
Synopsis: Life has never been easy for Eric Kenwood. A dead father, a mother who doesn't believe anything he says, and a step dad who appears to be out to get him. Down on his luck Eric has no choice but to ask his dreaded stepfather for a job. Losing his job, and potentially his apartment Erics inner tormoil is what lets him swallow his pride, and do whats best for him right now, that was until an assassination attempt goes wrong. Met by a blue screen with a startling message Eric closes what could be his only warning. "The Gods are ready to play Eric, are you...."Meeting a goddess, subterranean riches, forest fires, and goblin tribes, Erics once normal world has been turned upside down by a tiny object known as The Crystal Ring. Will he survive, and build a thriving civilization, or will he fail time after time. Having Immortality may not be all it's cracked up to be when it comes with a yet unknown catch.Welcome to my very first fiction ever, I am new to writing, but have decided to put my foot in the water.I wont make an upload schedule if I cant gain any traction as well as writing in my spare time I do not wish to disappoint.Have fun on the journey.   Temporary cover

Title: Fray
Synopsis:
Maverick Lopin plans to rob a starship. Lucky for him, he’s just been appointed that ship’s First Officer on a job to move expensive cargo across the war-torn galaxy. But Lopin never intends for the cargo to reach its destination. This is his payday.  
For ship captain Cassius Jet, his career and life are on the line. Ten years ago, he almost killed Maverick Lopin in a random assault. At the time, he didn’t know who the man was or if he even survived. Now that man is his First Officer, and all Jet can do is pray Lopin won’t remember him from that night. But what if he does? Jet has debts to pay and his marriage is on the rocks. He needs this mission to go right so he can retire, and that won’t happen if he’s in handcuffs. 
Lopin and Jet aren’t the only ones onboard with problems and plans to solve them. But as the starship takes off for its cross-galaxy trip, plots quickly become entangled and the fate of the starship hangs in the balance. Fray tells a tale of sabotage, revenge, redemption, survival - and what happens when the bad things you’ve done come back ‘round.

Title: Legends of The Great Savanna - Complete Book 1, Ongoing Book 2
Synopsis:
Welcome to the Great Savanna!
Explore hidden adventure within expansive grasslands, protect the unique race known as Martyrs, and discover the Legends of the Great Savanna. 
 Subscribe to author updates here - http://jllincoln.com/#specialoffersGet chapters and see artwork before anyone else here - https://www.patreon.com/jlincoln
 
Martyrs are a unique type of creature. They are born as tall as you or me and grow to twice our size. When they are cubs, their fur is the same golden brown as Savanna grass. Playful at heart, Martyr cubs prowl and hunt like humanoid lions. When they reach adulthood, their features harden. They begin walking on two feet, making it easier to handle the weight of their Ancient Oaths.
James is a normal type of human; short on cash, and desperately trying to build a life for himself. His parents died when he was a young teen, leaving only his little brother Michael behind. They made it through together, but James knew they would never have a comfortable life. So when the military approached him with a high paying contract, James couldn’t refuse. That was how he became the first person ever to enter a fully immersive virtual reality world.
Join James as he saves the life of a rambunctious Martyr cub, is adopted into their clan, and uses magical spells and abilities to help his new family grow from a small band of survivors on the run, into what they once were: ancient and powerful protectors of the Great Savanna. 
 
LitRPG Categories = Town Building, Warrior Mage Main Character (MC), Tower Defense, No Logout.

Title: Who Gives A Damn If I'm Not The Chosen Hero?!
Synopsis:
In a certain time, at a certain place, there exists a certain weapon. It is said to have brought an end to wars, an end to empires, an end to calamities.
Each time the weapon served its purpose, it was sealed away in this place, the tenets, experience, and wishes of its prior wielder interred with it.
These are quiet days in quiet times. The gods no longer interfere with the affairs of mortals. The world has weathered conflict after waning conflict. And the weapon has remained in its place for three centuries.
In a certain time, at a certain place, there exists a certain weapon. And yet, on this day, at this place, this weapon is absent. 
This is a recounting of the ninth and final time the weapon was drawn, the circumstances of its destruction, and the hero deemed unworthy of wielding it.

Title: [BL] Limited Time Offer: Great Transmigration Trip
Synopsis: The Ruler of Hell give Cyril Lancaster a limited-time offer, the chance to live again in exchange of collecting the scattered soul fragments from different dimensions or world . . .

Title: Excursion
Synopsis: The laws of reality have changed, and civilization has collapsed. This doesn't impact Jake, however, who survived the cataclysm and now has everything he needs to survive in his cozy little two-story house at the edge of the world - even an internet connection. But his life of safety and isolation is thrown into chaos one day when his internet suddenly fails; with customer support gone and no access to his favorite online games, he's forced to venture out into the surreal post-apocalyptic landscape to the distant internet service provider building to try and fix the problem himself.

Title: Inception of Cultivation
Synopsis:
Named Ezhno at birth, he seemed to be destined to live and traverse the world alone. After the strange death of his parents, he lived a pitiful childhood and grew up despised by an entire village. Forced to become an adult, with years of living a desolate life in the confines of the village; A ray of hope slowly melted away the oppressive darkness, he was able to fill the void with friendship and a new outlook on life.  Greed and malice shrouded his fragile little world, With death waiting for him at any moment, life shows him a way out, towards the brighter future in the form of cultivation.
Fueled by revenge, he travels the world not knowing if his fate would be rewarding or cruel and meaningless. We will witness the highs and lows, as he tries to piece together the enigma known as cultivation. Can he once again, find the meaning of happiness? Will Ezhno ever find a place to call his own? Can he ascend to the top and establish a new era of cultivation?

Title: Unparalleled: Noblesse Oblige
Synopsis:
Maximus was ready. His entire life trained him for this moment. The new game, Unparalleled, promised something that only existed in his dreams. Absolute sensory immersion. A dream come true for any dedicated gamer. Unparalleled came with no guides, no instructions, and no help. It was definitely the most interesting game release. With over a decade of virtual experience and anticipation in hand, he was about to tackle his hardest obstacle to date. Whether he dies a cowardly death or rises to become a paragon, his actions will tell.
Let the game begin.

The year 2055 
The forefront of Virtual Reality, Virtualis, unveiled the pinnacle of human technology. The Unparalleled Capsule (UPC) promised features untold in human history: Complete sense sync, time perception dilation, and above all, Free of charge for the first month. Preinstalled with a mysterious game called Unparalleled, Virtualis gifted the machine to anyone who inquired
At the same global time, over 5 million people virtualized their minds as they entered unknown territory. With over half the population transported to a new world, it was the event of the century. However, all things come at a cost. With untold dangers and obstacles, the players were forced to walk a thin line between life and death. And no, not temporary death, permanent, irreversible death.
 

Written as book one of Unparalleled: Maximus, this will be co-released with the first installment of Unparalleled: Solus.
My co-author and I are writing a series together. We are in the same universe in different perspectives. Hopefully, you enjoy his just as much as mine. 
Please check out Solus d'Erebus' story here:
https://royalroadl.com/fiction/15656/unparalleled-shadows-blade
 
 
Thank you for the support
Special thanks to my amazing editor and artist: Chaos

Title: Unparalleled: Shadow's Blade
Synopsis:
Solus only excelled at one game, Battle Cry, a PvP survival battle royale. He decided to try out the newest VRMMORPG: Unparalleled. Contrary to his expectations, he was trapped in a situation where death inside the game would result in death in real life. At what point do ethics come into play when danger lurks at every corner. To kill or be killed, the choice seems obvious… 
But is it really?

 
Year 2055 
The forefront of Virtual Reality, Virtualis, unveiled the pinnacle of human technology. The Unparalleled Capsule (UPC) promised features untold in human history: Complete sense sync, time perception dilation, and above all, Free of charge for the first month. Preinstalled with a mysterious game called Unparalleled, Virtualis gifted the machine to anyone who inquired
At the same global time, over 5 million people virtualized their minds as they entered unknown territory. With over half the population transported to a new world, it was the event of the century. However, all things come at a cost. With untold dangers and obstacles, the players were forced to walk a thin line between life and death. And no, not temporary death, permanent, irreversible death.

Written as book one of Unparalleled: Solus, this will be co-released with the first installment of Unparalleled: Maximus.
My co-authors and I began writing these series because wanted we wanted to show that there are always two sides to a story. It’s two different series based in the same universe and time but from two different perspectives. I’ve personally never seen a book written in this fashion before and it’s proving harder than I thought, however, I believe it’s worth it. 
“Perception is reality.” ~Steve Young
Please do take a look at Hecadeath’s  novel down below!
https://royalroadl.com/fiction/15655/unparalleled-noblesse-oblige
 
Reviews and critiques are more than welcome!
 
Thanks for reading! Also I wanna give a special shout to our editor and artist Chaos!

Title: Chaos (old)
Synopsis:
Once upon a time, there was a boy.
A boy who only knew to take.
A boy who brought the night...
Once upon a time, there was a girl.
A girl who only knew to give.
A girl who brought the day...
And once upon a time, the demon king met a god.
Time flows by, and now there is only the boy.
A broken boy.
A boy who knew only to take.
A boy who brought the night.
But now he wonders: 
Why?
Why must he only take?
Why must he bring the night?
And why must the day die for the night to be born?

Title: Wilderness Online W.O.
Synopsis:
Hi, my name is Alena.  I have mid-back length black hair and pale white skin that goes well with my Asian features.  I have an athletic build and I'm a bit petite.  I'm 152 centimeters and 43 kilograms.
  I was raised as an only child. I am independently wealthy (read: won the lotto) and I live alone in a small house in the suburbs.
  Today I just got my brand new game console and game, W.O. this is the game of the decade by Animagus Industries.  It's just arrived the tech guys from Animagus are here to install it because it is a lot of sophisticated equipment.  The game console is actually a FIVR pod.  It has a month-long dive time RL with a 4:1 time compression ratio meaning every four hours in-game is an hour IRL.  As long as you don't eat any solid food when you enter it should be able to break down any waste you produce after you've entered.  It has a fully automated med-bed meaning it prevents muscle atrophy and kicks you out of the game if you're having any medical problems while also calling for an ambulance.
  As I started to boot up my pod I took a deep breath and started to get dressed into my skin suit so the pod could get better readings.  Then I hopped in the pod and closed my eyes and when they opened I saw a whole new world.

  Readers this is the synopsis/prologue sorry but this is all for right now starting the story off on my tablet, not something easy to do...  Hope you enjoy the story.  The first chapter is going to be the Glossary/Infodump.

Title: Gears Of Rust (Abandoned)
Synopsis:
An adventurous story within a post-apocalyptic Earth, with a new twist to the cyberpunk sub-genre. Merging together the post-apocalyptic scenario with Sci-Fi elements and some Fantasy.
Follow young Jayce's misadventure through the hardships of survival within barren lands and others, fighting for one's dear life against impossible odds and finally...something else.
 

 
Beyond the end, there is new beginnings. If anything is left to start it out...
The world has long ended, for what reason nobody remembers. Society has taken several steps back, as people learned to live within the barren lands they were left with. Survival is an everyday struggle within the village cut off from the rest of the world.
Even for Jayce, a young boy of fourteen.
Everyday was the same for Jayce. Wake up then wash within the mildly clean water and then dress with whatever tatters remained together. He'd eat a somewhat satisfying meal of whatever rodent his traps caught during the night or what leftovers his employers didn't wolf down at dinner yesterday.
The rest of the day? Clean, do chores and...clean some more.
Jayce was a servant for the village's guard, an honor they told him. But he didn't believe all that, he knew he was just another poor runt nobody could feed yet nobody could watch die on the street either...or well...nobody wanted to clean up the next morning.
Water was limited per day by the masters, food even more so but more due to lack of. Yet the village of Oasis made due, no matter what. It was a rather large village, surviving mostly off the actual oasis it was built over. The village's iron buildings twisted and rose above the water, held up by large wooden platforms and pathways. Several hundred meters, so high up that falling would lead to instant death.
Even if you landed in the water, which you most probably would anyway. Unless you were...Ahem...thrown at an awkward angle.
Every day was the same...But one day, everything went as wrong as it possibly could go for poor little Jayce.
